   21: -module(process_SUITE).

   24: %% 	exit/1

  117: suite() ->
  118:     [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]},
  119:      {timetrap, {minutes, 9}}].

  122:     [spawn_with_binaries, t_exit_1, {group, t_exit_2},
  123:      trap_exit_badarg, trap_exit_badarg_in_bif,
  124:      bump_reductions, low_prio, yield, yield2, otp_4725,
  125:      dist_unlink_ack_exit_leak, bad_register, garbage_collect,
  126:      process_flag_badarg,
  127:      process_flag_fullsweep_after, process_flag_heap_size,
  128:      command_line_max_heap_size,
  129:      spawn_opt_heap_size, spawn_opt_max_heap_size,
  130:      more_spawn_opt_max_heap_size,
  131:      spawn_huge_arglist,
  132:      otp_6237,
  133:      {group, spawn_request},
  134:      {group, process_info_bif},

  142: groups() -> 
  143:     [{t_exit_2, [],

  149:        spawn_request_monitor_demonitor,

  170:        process_info_other, process_info_other_msg,

  200: 
  201: init_per_suite(Config) ->
  202:     A0 = case application:start(sasl) of
  203: 	     ok -> [sasl];
  204: 	     _ -> []
  205: 	 end,
  206:     A = case application:start(os_mon) of
  207: 	     ok -> [os_mon|A0];
  208: 	     _ -> A0
  209: 	 end,
  210:     [{started_apps, A}|Config].
  211: 
  212: end_per_suite(Config) ->
  213:     As = proplists:get_value(started_apps, Config),
  214:     lists:foreach(fun (A) -> application:stop(A) end, As),
  215:     catch erts_debug:set_internal_state(available_internal_state, false),
  216:     Config.
  217: 
  218: init_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
  219:     Config.
  220: 
  221: end_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
  222:     Config.
  223: 
  224: init_per_testcase(Func, Config)
  225:   when Func =:= processes_default_tab;
  226:        Func =:= processes_this_tab ->
  227:     case erlang:system_info(build_type) of
  228:         BT when BT =:= debug; BT =:= valgrind ->
  229:             {skip, "Don't run in debug/valgrind"};
  230:         _ ->
  231:             [{testcase, Func} | Config]
  232:     end;
  233: init_per_testcase(Func, Config) when is_atom(Func), is_list(Config) ->
  234:     [{testcase, Func}|Config].
  235: 
  236: end_per_testcase(Func, Config) when is_atom(Func), is_list(Config) ->
  237:     %% Restore max_heap_size to default value.
  238:     erlang:system_flag(max_heap_size,
  239:                        #{size => 0,
  240:                          kill => true,
  241:                          include_shared_binaries => false,
  242:                          error_logger => true}),
  243:     erts_test_utils:ept_check_leaked_nodes(Config).
  244: 
  245: fun_spawn(Fun) ->
  246:     spawn_link(erlang, apply, [Fun, []]).
  247: 
  248: %% Tests that binaries as arguments to spawn/3 doesn't leak
  249: %% (unclear if this test case will actually prove anything on
  250: %% a modern computer with lots of memory).
  251: spawn_with_binaries(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  252:     L = lists:duplicate(2048, 42),
  253:     TwoMeg = lists:duplicate(1024, L),
  254:     Fun = fun() -> spawn(?MODULE, binary_owner, [list_to_binary(TwoMeg)]),
  255: 			 receive after 1 -> ok end end,
  256:     Iter = case test_server:is_valgrind() of
  257: 		     true -> 10;
  258: 		     false -> 150
  259: 		 end,
  260:     test_server:do_times(Iter, Fun),
  261:     ok.
  262: 
  263: binary_owner(Bin) when is_binary(Bin) ->
  264:     ok.
  265: 
  266: %% Tests exit/1 with a big message.
  267: t_exit_1(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  268:     ct:timetrap({seconds, 20}),
  269:     start_spawner(),
  270:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  271:     test_server:do_times(10, fun t_exit_1/0),
  272:     stop_spawner(),
  273:     ok.
  274: 
  275: t_exit_1() ->
  276:     Pid = fun_spawn(fun() -> exit(kb_128()) end),
  277:     Garbage = kb_128(),
  278:     receive
  279: 	      {'EXIT', Pid, Garbage} -> ok
  280: 	  end.
  281: 
  282: 
  283: %% Tests exit/2 with a lot of data in the exit message.
  284: t_exit_2_other(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  285:     ct:timetrap({seconds, 20}),
  286:     start_spawner(),
  287:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  288:     test_server:do_times(10, fun t_exit_2_other/0),
  289:     stop_spawner(),
  290:     ok.
  291: 
  292: t_exit_2_other() ->
  293:     Pid = fun_spawn(fun() -> receive x -> ok end end),
  294:     Garbage = kb_128(),
  295:     exit(Pid, Garbage),
  296:     receive
  297: 	      {'EXIT', Pid, Garbage} -> ok
  298: 	  end.
  299: 
  300: %% Tests that exit(Pid, normal) does not kill another process.;
  301: t_exit_2_other_normal(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  302:     ct:timetrap({seconds, 20}),
  303:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  304:     Pid = fun_spawn(fun() -> receive x -> ok end end),
  305:     exit(Pid, normal),
  306:     receive
  307: 	      {'EXIT', Pid, Reason} ->
  308: 		  ct:fail({process_died, Reason})
  309: 	  after 1000 ->
  310: 		  ok
  311: 	  end,
  312:     case process_info(Pid) of
  313: 	      undefined ->
  314: 		  ct:fail(process_died_on_normal);
  315: 	      List when is_list(List) ->
  316: 		  ok
  317: 	  end,
  318:     exit(Pid, kill),
  319:     ok.
  320: 
  321: %% Tests that we can trap an exit message sent with exit/2 from
  322: %% the same process.
  323: self_exit(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  324:     ct:timetrap({seconds, 10}),
  325:     start_spawner(),
  326:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  327:     test_server:do_times(200, fun self_exit/0),
  328:     stop_spawner(),
  329:     ok.
  330: 
  331: self_exit() ->
  332:     Garbage = eight_kb(),
  333:     P = self(),
  334:     true = exit(P, Garbage),
  335:     receive
  336: 	      {'EXIT', P, Garbage} -> ok
  337: 	  end.
  338: 
  339: %% Tests exit(self(), normal) is equivalent to exit(normal) for a process
  340: %% that doesn't trap exits.
  341: normal_suicide_exit(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  342:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  343:     Pid = fun_spawn(fun() -> exit(self(), normal) end),
  344:     receive
  345: 	      {'EXIT', Pid, normal} -> ok;
  346: 	      Other -> ct:fail({bad_message, Other})
  347: 	  end.
  348: 
  349: %% Tests exit(self(), Term) is equivalent to exit(Term) for a process
  350: %% that doesn't trap exits.";
  351: abnormal_suicide_exit(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  352:     Garbage = eight_kb(),
  353:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  354:     Pid = fun_spawn(fun() -> exit(self(), Garbage) end),
  355:     receive
  356: 	      {'EXIT', Pid, Garbage} -> ok;
  357: 	      Other -> ct:fail({bad_message, Other})
  358: 	  end.
  359: 
  360: %% Tests that exit(self(), die) cannot be caught.
  361: t_exit_2_catch(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  362:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  363:     Pid = fun_spawn(fun() -> catch exit(self(), die) end),
  364:     receive
  365: 	      {'EXIT', Pid, normal} ->
  366: 		  ct:fail(catch_worked);
  367: 	      {'EXIT', Pid, die} ->
  368: 		  ok;
  369: 	      Other ->
  370: 		  ct:fail({bad_message, Other})
  371: 	  end.
  372: 
  373: %% Tests trapping of an 'EXIT' message generated by a bad argument to
  374: %% the abs/1 bif.  The 'EXIT' message will intentionally be very big.
  375: trap_exit_badarg(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  376:     ct:timetrap({seconds, 10}),
  377:     start_spawner(),
  378:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  379:     try
  380:         %% suppress  =ERROR REPORT=== emulator messages
  381:         ok = logger:add_primary_filter(suppress_log_spam, {
  382:             fun(#{meta := #{error_logger := #{emulator := true, tag := error}}}, _Report) ->
  383:                 stop;
  384:             (_Meta, _Report) ->
  385:                 ignore
  386:             end, ok}),
  387:         test_server:do_times(10, fun trap_exit_badarg/0),
  388:         ct:sleep(500) %% flush logging
  389:     after
  390:         ok = logger:remove_primary_filter(suppress_log_spam)
  391:     end,
  392:     stop_spawner(),
  393:     ok.
  394: 
  395: trap_exit_badarg() ->
  396:     Pid = fun_spawn(fun() -> bad_guy(kb_128()) end),
  397:     Garbage = kb_128(),
  398:     receive
  399: 	      {'EXIT',Pid,{badarg,[{erlang,abs,[Garbage],Loc1},
  400: 				   {?MODULE,bad_guy,1,Loc2}|_]}}
  401: 	      when is_list(Loc1), is_list(Loc2) ->
  402: 		  ok;
  403: 	      Other ->
  404: 		  ok = io:format("Bad EXIT message: ~P", [Other, 30]),
  405: 		  ct:fail(bad_exit_message)
  406: 	  end.
  407: 
  408: bad_guy(Arg) ->
  409:     abs(Arg).
  410: 
  411: 
  412: kb_128() ->
  413:     Eight = eight_kb(),
  414:     {big_binary(),
  415:      Eight, Eight, Eight, Eight, Eight, Eight, Eight, Eight,
  416:      big_binary(),
  417:      Eight, Eight, Eight, Eight, Eight, Eight, Eight, Eight,
  418:      big_binary()}.
  419: 
  420: eight_kb() ->
  421:     B64 = lists:seq(1, 64),
  422:     B512 = {<<1>>,B64,<<2,3>>,B64,make_unaligned_sub_binary(<<4,5,6,7,8,9>>),
  423: 		  B64,make_sub_binary([1,2,3,4,5,6]),
  424: 		  B64,make_sub_binary(lists:seq(1, ?heap_binary_size+1)),
  425: 		  B64,B64,B64,B64,big_binary()},
  426:     lists:duplicate(8, {B512,B512}).
  427: 
  428: big_binary() ->
  429:     big_binary(10, [42]).
  430: big_binary(0, Acc) ->
  431:     list_to_binary(Acc);
  432: big_binary(N, Acc) ->
  433:     big_binary(N-1, [Acc|Acc]).
  434: 
  435: %% Test receiving an EXIT message when spawning a BIF with bad arguments.
  436: trap_exit_badarg_in_bif(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  437:     ct:timetrap({seconds, 10}),
  438:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  439:     test_server:do_times(10, fun trap_exit_badarg_bif/0),
  440:     ok.
  441:     
  442: trap_exit_badarg_bif() ->
  443:     Pid = spawn_link(erlang, node, [1]),
  444:     receive
  445: 	      {'EXIT', Pid, {badarg, _}} ->
  446: 		  ok;
  447: 	      Other ->
  448: 		  ct:fail({unexpected, Other})
  449: 	  end.
  450: 
  451: %% The following sequences of events have crasched Beam.
  452: %%
  453: %% 1) An exit is sent to a process which is currently not running.
  454: %%    The exit reason will (on purpose) overwrite the message queue
  455: %%    pointer.
  456: %% 2) Before the process is scheduled in, it receives a timeout (from
  457: %%    a 'receive after').
  458: %% 3) The process will crash the next time it executes 'receive'.
  459: 
  460: exit_and_timeout(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  461:     ct:timetrap({seconds, 20}),
  462: 
  463:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  464:     Parent = self(),
  465:     Low = fun_spawn(fun() -> eat_low(Parent) end),
  466:     High = fun_spawn(fun() -> eat_high(Low) end),
  467:     eat_wait_for(Low, High),
  468:     ok.
  469: 
  470: 
  471: eat_wait_for(Low, High) ->
  472:     receive
  473: 	{'EXIT', Low, {you, are, dead}} ->
  474: 	    ok;
  475: 	{'EXIT', High, normal} ->
  476: 	    eat_wait_for(Low, High);
  477: 	Other ->
  478: 	    ct:fail({bad_message, Other})
  479:     end.
  480: 
  481: eat_low(_Parent) ->
  482:     receive
  483:     after 2500 ->
  484: 	    ok
  485:     end,
  486:     receive
  487: 	Any ->
  488: 	    io:format("Received: ~p\n", [Any])
  489:     after 1000 ->
  490: 	    ok
  491:     end.
  492:     
  493: eat_high(Low) ->
  494:     process_flag(priority, high),
  495:     receive after 1000 -> ok end,
  496:     exit(Low, {you, are, dead}),
  497:     loop(erlang:monotonic_time() + erlang:convert_time_unit(5,second,native)).
  498: 
  499: %% Busy loop for 5 seconds.
  500: 
  501: loop(StopTime) ->
  502:     case StopTime >= erlang:monotonic_time() of
  503: 	true -> ok;
  504: 	false -> loop(StopTime)
  505:     end.
  506: 
  507: 
  508: %% Tries to send two different exit messages to a process.
  509: %% (The second one should be ignored.)
  510: exit_twice(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  511:     ct:timetrap({seconds, 20}),
  512: 
  513:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  514:     Low = fun_spawn(fun etwice_low/0),
  515:     High = fun_spawn(fun() -> etwice_high(Low) end),
  516:     etwice_wait_for(Low, High),
  517:     ok.
  518: 
  519: etwice_wait_for(Low, High) ->
  520:     receive
  521: 	{'EXIT', Low, first} ->
  522: 	    ok;
  523: 	{'EXIT', Low, Other} ->
  524: 	    ct:fail({wrong_exit_reason, Other});
  525: 	{'EXIT', High, normal} ->
  526: 	    etwice_wait_for(Low, High);
  527: 	Other ->
  528: 	    ct:fail({bad_message, Other})
  529:     end.
  530: 
  531: etwice_low() ->
  532:     etwice_low().
  533: 
  534: etwice_high(Low) ->
  535:     process_flag(priority, high),
  536:     exit(Low, first),
  537:     exit(Low, second).
  538: 
  539: %% Tests the process_info/2 BIF.
  540: t_process_info(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  541:     [] = process_info(self(), registered_name),
  542:     register(my_name, self()),
  543:     {registered_name, my_name} = process_info(self(), registered_name),
  544:     {status, running} = process_info(self(), status),
  545:     {min_heap_size, 233} = process_info(self(), min_heap_size),
  546:     {min_bin_vheap_size,46422} = process_info(self(), min_bin_vheap_size),
  547:     {max_heap_size, #{ size := 0, kill := true, error_logger := true,
  548:                        include_shared_binaries := false}} =
  549:         process_info(self(), max_heap_size),
  550:     {current_function,{?MODULE,t_process_info,1}} =
  551: 	process_info(self(), current_function),
  552:     {current_function,{?MODULE,t_process_info,1}} =
  553: 	apply(erlang, process_info, [self(),current_function]),
  554: 
  555:     %% current_location and current_stacktrace
  556:     {Line1,Res1} = {?LINE,process_info(self(), current_location)},
  557:     verify_loc(Line1, Res1),
  558:     {Line2,Res2} = {?LINE,apply(erlang, process_info,
  559: 				[self(),current_location])},
  560:     verify_loc(Line2, Res2),
  561:     pi_stacktrace([{?MODULE,t_process_info,1,?LINE}]),
  562: 
  563:     verify_stacktrace_depth(),
  564: 
  565:     Gleader = group_leader(),
  566:     {group_leader, Gleader} = process_info(self(), group_leader),
  567:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_Info}} = (catch process_info('not_a_pid')),
  568:     ok.
  569: 
  570: verify_stacktrace_depth() ->
  571:     CS = current_stacktrace,
  572:     OldDepth = erlang:system_flag(backtrace_depth, 0),
  573:     {CS,[]} = erlang:process_info(self(), CS),
  574:     _ = erlang:system_flag(backtrace_depth, 8),
  575:     {CS,[{?MODULE,verify_stacktrace_depth,0,_},_|_]} =
  576:         erlang:process_info(self(), CS),
  577:     _ = erlang:system_flag(backtrace_depth, OldDepth).
  578: 
  579: pi_stacktrace(Expected0) ->
  580:     {Line,Res} = {?LINE,erlang:process_info(self(), current_stacktrace)},
  581:     {current_stacktrace,Stack} = Res,
  582:     Expected = [{?MODULE,pi_stacktrace,1,Line}|Expected0],
  583:     pi_stacktrace_1(Stack, Expected).
  584: 
  585: pi_stacktrace_1([{M,F,A,Loc}|Stk], [{M,F,A,Line}|Exp]) ->
  586:     case Loc of
  587: 	[] ->
  588: 	    %% No location info for some reason (+L, native code).
  589: 	    io:format("Missing location information for ~w:~w/~w",
  590: 		      [M,F,A]),
  591: 	    ok;
  592: 	[_|_] ->
  593: 	    Line = proplists:get_value(line, Loc),
  594: 	    File = proplists:get_value(file, Loc),
  595: 	    File = ?MODULE_STRING ++ ".erl"
  596:     end,
  597:     pi_stacktrace_1(Stk, Exp);
  598: pi_stacktrace_1([_|_], []) -> ok.
  599: 
  600: verify_loc(Line, {current_location,{?MODULE,t_process_info=F,1=A,Loc}}) ->
  601:     case Loc of
  602: 	[] ->
  603: 	    %% No location info for some reason (+L, native code).
  604: 	    io:format("Missing location information for ~w:~w/~w",
  605: 		      [?MODULE,F,A]),
  606: 	    ok;
  607: 	[_|_] ->
  608: 	    Line = proplists:get_value(line, Loc),
  609: 	    File = proplists:get_value(file, Loc),
  610: 	    File = ?MODULE_STRING ++ ".erl"
  611:     end.
  612: 
  613: process_info_other(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  614:     Self = self(),
  615:     Pid = spawn_link(fun() -> process_info_looper(Self) end),
  616:     receive after 1 -> ok end,
  617:     pio_current_location(10000, Pid, 0, 0),
  618:     pio_current_stacktrace().
  619: 
  620: pio_current_location(0, _, Pi, Looper) ->
  621:     io:format("~w call(s) to erlang:process_info/2", [Pi]),
  622:     io:format("~w call(s) to ~w:process_info_looper/1", [Looper,?MODULE]);
  623: pio_current_location(N, Pid, Pi, Looper) ->
  624:     erlang:yield(),
  625:     {current_location,Where} = process_info(Pid, current_location),
  626:     case Where of
  627: 	{erlang,process_info,2,[]} ->
  628: 	    pio_current_location(N-1, Pid, Pi+1, Looper);
  629: 	{erts_internal,await_result,1, Loc} when is_list(Loc) ->
  630: 	    pio_current_location(N-1, Pid, Pi+1, Looper);
  631: 	{?MODULE,process_info_looper,1,Loc} when is_list(Loc) ->
  632: 	    pio_current_location(N-1, Pid, Pi, Looper+1);
  633: 	_ ->
  634: 	    exit({unexpected_location, Where})
  635:     end.
  636: 
  637: pio_current_stacktrace() ->
  638:     L = [begin
  639: 	     case process_info(P, current_stacktrace) of
  640:                  {current_stacktrace, Stk} -> {P,Stk};
  641:                  undefined -> {P, []}
  642:              end
  643: 	 end || P <- processes()],
  644:     [erlang:garbage_collect(P) || {P,_} <- L],
  645:     erlang:garbage_collect(),
  646:     [verify_stacktrace(Stk) || {_,Stk} <- L],
  647:     ok.
  648: 
  649: verify_stacktrace([{M,F,A,Loc}|T])
  650:   when is_atom(M),
  651:        is_atom(F),
  652:        is_integer(A),
  653:        is_list(Loc) ->
  654:     verify_stacktrace(T);
  655: verify_stacktrace([]) -> ok.
  656: 
  657: process_info_looper(Parent) ->
  658:     process_info(Parent, current_location),
  659:     process_info_looper(Parent).
  660: 
  661: %% Tests the process_info/1 BIF on another process with messages.
  662: process_info_other_msg(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  663:     Self = self(),
  664:     Pid = spawn_link(fun() -> other_process(Self) end),
  665:     receive
  666: 	{go_ahead,Pid} -> ok
  667:     end,
  668: 
  669:     Own = {my,own,message},
  670: 
  671:     {messages,[Own]} = process_info(Pid, messages),
  672:     
  673:     Garbage = kb_128(),
  674:     MsgA = {a,Garbage},
  675:     MsgB = {b,Garbage},
  676:     MsgC = {c,Garbage},
  677:     MsgD = {d,Garbage},
  678:     MsgE = {e,Garbage},
  679: 
  680:     Pid ! MsgA,
  681:     {messages,[Own,MsgA]} = process_info(Pid, messages),
  682:     Pid ! MsgB,
  683:     {messages,[Own,MsgA,MsgB]} = process_info(Pid, messages),
  684:     Pid ! MsgC,
  685:     {messages,[Own,MsgA,MsgB,MsgC]} = process_info(Pid, messages),
  686:     Pid ! MsgD,
  687:     {messages,[Own,MsgA,MsgB,MsgC,MsgD]} = process_info(Pid, messages),
  688:     Pid ! MsgE,
  689:     {messages,[Own,MsgA,MsgB,MsgC,MsgD,MsgE]=All} = process_info(Pid, messages),
  690:     {memory,BytesOther} = process_info(Pid, memory),
  691:     {memory,BytesSelf} = process_info(self(), memory),
  692: 
  693:     io:format("Memory ~p: ~p\n", [Pid,BytesOther]),
  694:     io:format("Memory ~p (self): ~p\n", [self(),BytesSelf]),
  695: 
  696:     [Own,MsgA,MsgB,MsgC,MsgD,MsgE] = All,
  697: 
  698:     Pid ! {self(),empty},
  699:     receive
  700: 	      empty -> ok
  701: 	  end,
  702:     {messages,[]} = process_info(Pid, messages),
  703: 
  704:     {min_heap_size, 233} = process_info(Pid, min_heap_size),
  705:     {min_bin_vheap_size, 46422} = process_info(Pid, min_bin_vheap_size),
  706:     {max_heap_size, #{ size := 0, kill := true, error_logger := true,
  707:                        include_shared_binaries := false}} =
  708:         process_info(Pid, max_heap_size),
  709: 
  710:     Pid ! stop,
  711:     ok.
  712: 
  713: process_info_other_message_queue_len_signal_race(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  714:     %% OTP-18169
  715:     %%
  716:     %% The race window triggering this bug is quite small. This test
  717:     %% wont fail even with the bug present, but it may trigger an
  718:     %% assertion in the debug compiled emulator if the bug is
  719:     %% present...
  720:     process_flag(priority, high),
  721:     SSchdlr = case erlang:system_info(schedulers_online) of
  722:                   1 -> 1;
  723:                   _ -> 2
  724:               end,
  725:     Flush = fun Flush () ->
  726:                     receive _ -> Flush()
  727:                     after 0 -> ok
  728:                     end
  729:             end,
  730:     RFun = fun RFun () ->
  731:                    receive
  732:                        {flush, From} ->
  733:                            Flush(),
  734:                            From ! flushed
  735:                    end,
  736:                    RFun()
  737:            end,
  738:     R = spawn_opt(RFun, [link,
  739:                          {scheduler, 1},
  740:                          {message_queue_data, on_heap}]),
  741:     SFun = fun SFun () ->
  742:                    receive go -> ok end,
  743:                    M = erlang:monitor(process, R),
  744:                    R ! hi,
  745:                    receive
  746:                        {demonitor, From} ->
  747:                            _ = erlang:demonitor(M),
  748:                            From ! demonitored
  749:                    end,
  750:                    SFun()
  751:            end,
  752:     S = spawn_opt(SFun, [link,
  753:                          {scheduler, SSchdlr},
  754:                          {priority, high}]),
  755:     process_info_other_message_queue_len_signal_race_test(10000, S, R),
  756:     unlink(R),
  757:     exit(R, kill),
  758:     unlink(S),
  759:     exit(S, kill),
  760:     false = is_process_alive(R),
  761:     false = is_process_alive(S),
  762:     ok.
  763: 
  764: process_info_other_message_queue_len_signal_race_test(0, _S, _R) ->
  765:     ok;
  766: process_info_other_message_queue_len_signal_race_test(N, S, R) ->
  767:     S ! go,
  768:     erlang:yield(),
  769:     _ = process_info(R, message_queue_len),
  770:     S ! {demonitor, self()},
  771:     receive demonitored -> ok end,
  772:     R ! {flush, self()},
  773:     receive flushed -> ok end,
  774:     process_info_other_message_queue_len_signal_race_test(N-1, S, R).
  775: 
  776: process_info_other_dist_msg(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  777:     %%
  778:     %% Check that process_info can handle messages that have not been
  779:     %% decoded yet.
  780:     %%
  781:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(),
  782:     Self = self(),
  783:     Pid = spawn_link(fun() -> other_process(Self) end),
  784:     receive {go_ahead,Pid} -> ok end,
  785: 
  786:     Own = {my,own,message},
  787: 
  788:     {messages,[Own]} = process_info(Pid, messages),
  789:     Garbage = kb_128(),
  790:     MsgA = {a,self(),Garbage},
  791:     MsgB = {b,self(),Garbage},
  792:     MsgC = {c,self(),Garbage},
  793:     MsgD = {d,self(),Garbage},
  794:     MsgE = {e,self(),Garbage},
  795: 
  796:     %% We don't want the other process to decode messages itself
  797:     %% therefore we suspend it.
  798:     true =  erlang:suspend_process(Pid),
  799:     spawn_link(Node, fun () ->
  800: 		Pid  ! MsgA,
  801: 		Pid  ! MsgB,
  802: 		Pid  ! MsgC,
  803: 		Self ! check_abc
  804: 	end),
  805:     receive check_abc -> ok end,
  806:     [{status,suspended},
  807: 	{messages,[Own,MsgA,MsgB,MsgC]},
  808: 	{status,suspended}]= process_info(Pid, [status,messages,status]),
  809:     spawn_link(Node, fun () ->
  810: 		Pid  ! MsgD,
  811: 		Pid  ! MsgE,
  812: 		Self ! check_de
  813: 	end),
  814:     receive check_de -> ok end,
  815:     {messages,[Own,MsgA,MsgB,MsgC,MsgD,MsgE]=All} = process_info(Pid, messages),
  816:     true = erlang:resume_process(Pid),
  817:     Pid ! {self(), get_all_messages},
  818:     receive
  819: 	      {all_messages, AllMsgs} ->
  820: 		  All = AllMsgs
  821: 	  end,
  822:     {messages,[]} = process_info(Pid, messages),
  823:     Pid ! stop,
  824:     stop_node(Peer, Node),
  825:     ok.
  826: 
  827: process_info_other_status(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  828:     %% OTP-17628: status was erroneously reported as 'running',
  829:     %% when it should be 'waiting', when the priority of the
  830:     %% caller exceeded the priority of the processes being
  831:     %% checked (due to prio elevation).
  832:     Self = self(),
  833:     Other = spawn_link(fun () -> other_process(Self) end),
  834:     receive {go_ahead, Other} -> ok end,
  835:     receive after 100 -> ok end,
  836:     {status, waiting} = process_info(Other, status),
  837:     process_flag(priority, high),
  838:     {status, waiting} = process_info(Other, status),
  839:     process_flag(priority, max),
  840:     {status, waiting} = process_info(Other, status),
  841:     Other ! stop,
  842:     ok.
  843: 
  844: other_process(Parent) ->
  845:     self() ! {my,own,message},
  846:     Parent ! {go_ahead,self()},
  847:     other_process_1().
  848: 
  849: other_process_1() ->
  850:     receive
  851: 	{Parent,get_all_messages} ->
  852: 	    Parent ! {all_messages, get_all_messages()},
  853: 	    other_process_1();
  854: 	{Parent,empty} ->
  855: 	    receive_all(),
  856: 	    Parent ! empty,
  857: 	    other_process_1();
  858: 	stop -> ok
  859:     end.
  860: 
  861: get_all_messages() ->
  862:     get_all_messages([]).
  863: 
  864: get_all_messages(Msgs) ->
  865:     receive
  866: 	Msg ->
  867: 	    get_all_messages([Msg|Msgs])
  868:     after 0 ->
  869: 	    lists:reverse(Msgs)
  870:     end.
  871: 
  872: receive_all() ->
  873:     receive
  874: 	_ -> receive_all()
  875:     after 0 -> ok
  876:     end.
  877: 
  878: chk_pi_order([],[]) ->
  879:     ok;
  880: chk_pi_order([{Arg, _}| Values], [Arg|Args]) ->
  881:     chk_pi_order(Values, Args).
  882: 
  883: process_info_2_list(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  884:     Proc = spawn_link(fun () -> receive after infinity -> ok end end),
  885:     register(process_SUITE_process_info_2_list1, self()),
  886:     register(process_SUITE_process_info_2_list2, Proc),
  887:     erts_debug:set_internal_state(available_internal_state,true),
  888:     AllArgs = erts_debug:get_internal_state(process_info_args),
  889:     A1 = lists:sort(AllArgs) ++ [status] ++ lists:reverse(AllArgs),
  890: 
  891:     %% Verify that argument is accepted as single atom
  892:     lists:foreach(fun (A) ->
  893: 		{A, _} = process_info(Proc, A),
  894: 		{A, _} = process_info(self(), A)
  895: 	end, A1),
  896: 
  897:     %% Verify that order is preserved
  898:     ok = chk_pi_order(process_info(self(), A1), A1),
  899:     ok = chk_pi_order(process_info(Proc, A1), A1),
  900: 
  901:     %% Small arg list
  902:     A2 = [status, stack_size, trap_exit, priority],
  903:     [{status, _}, {stack_size, _}, {trap_exit, _}, {priority, _}]
  904: 	= process_info(Proc, A2),
  905:     [{status, _}, {stack_size, _}, {trap_exit, _}, {priority, _}]
  906: 	= process_info(self(), A2),
  907: 
  908:     %% Huge arg list (note values are shared)
  909:     A3 = lists:duplicate(5000,backtrace),
  910:     V3 = process_info(Proc, A3),
  911:     5000 = length(V3),
  912:     lists:foreach(fun ({backtrace, _}) -> ok end, V3),
  913:     ok.
  914:     
  915: process_info_lock_reschedule(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  916:     %% We need a process that is running and an item that requires
  917:     %% process_info to take the main process lock.
  918:     Target1 = spawn_link(fun tok_loop/0),
  919:     Name1 = process_info_lock_reschedule_running,
  920:     register(Name1, Target1),
  921:     Target2 = spawn_link(fun () -> receive after infinity -> ok end end),
  922:     Name2 = process_info_lock_reschedule_waiting,
  923:     register(Name2, Target2),
  924:     PI = fun(_) ->
  925: 	    erlang:yield(),
  926: 	    [{registered_name, Name1}] = process_info(Target1, [registered_name]),
  927: 	    [{registered_name, Name2}] = process_info(Target2, [registered_name]),
  928: 	    erlang:yield(),
  929: 	    {registered_name, Name1} = process_info(Target1, registered_name),
  930: 	    {registered_name, Name2} = process_info(Target2, registered_name),
  931: 	    erlang:yield(),
  932: 	    [{registered_name, Name1}| _] = process_info(Target1),
  933: 	    [{registered_name, Name2}| _] = process_info(Target2)
  934:     end,
  935:     lists:foreach(PI, lists:seq(1,1000)),
  936:     %% Make sure Target1 still is willing to "tok loop"
  937:     case process_info(Target1, status) of
  938: 	{status, OkStatus} when OkStatus == runnable;
  939: 				OkStatus == running;
  940: 				OkStatus == garbage_collecting ->
  941: 	    unlink(Target1),
  942: 	    unlink(Target2),
  943: 	    exit(Target1, bang),
  944: 	    exit(Target2, bang),
  945: 	    OkStatus;
  946: 	{status, BadStatus} ->
  947: 	    ct:fail(BadStatus)
  948:     end.
  949: 
  950: pi_loop(_Name, _Pid, 0) ->
  951:     ok;
  952: pi_loop(Name, Pid, N) ->
  953:     {registered_name, Name} = process_info(Pid, registered_name),
  954:     pi_loop(Name, Pid, N-1).
  955: 
  956: process_info_lock_reschedule2(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  957:     Parent = self(),
  958:     Fun = fun () ->
  959: 	    receive {go, Name, Pid} -> ok end,
  960: 	    pi_loop(Name, Pid, 10000),
  961: 	    Parent ! {done, self()},
  962: 	    receive after infinity -> ok end
  963:     end,
  964:     P1 = spawn_link(Fun),
  965:     N1 = process_info_lock_reschedule2_1,
  966:     true = register(N1, P1),
  967:     P2 = spawn_link(Fun),
  968:     N2 = process_info_lock_reschedule2_2,
  969:     true = register(N2, P2),
  970:     P3 = spawn_link(Fun),
  971:     N3 = process_info_lock_reschedule2_3,
  972:     true = register(N3, P3),
  973:     P4 = spawn_link(Fun),
  974:     N4 = process_info_lock_reschedule2_4,
  975:     true = register(N4, P4),
  976:     P5 = spawn_link(Fun),
  977:     N5 = process_info_lock_reschedule2_5,
  978:     true = register(N5, P5),
  979:     P6 = spawn_link(Fun),
  980:     N6 = process_info_lock_reschedule2_6,
  981:     true = register(N6, P6),
  982:     P1 ! {go, N2, P2},
  983:     P2 ! {go, N1, P1},
  984:     P3 ! {go, N1, P1},
  985:     P4 ! {go, N1, P1},
  986:     P5 ! {go, N6, P6},
  987:     P6 ! {go, N5, P5},
  988:     receive {done, P1} -> ok end,
  989:     receive {done, P2} -> ok end,
  990:     receive {done, P3} -> ok end,
  991:     receive {done, P4} -> ok end,
  992:     receive {done, P5} -> ok end,
  993:     receive {done, P6} -> ok end,
  994:     unlink(P1), exit(P1, bang),
  995:     unlink(P2), exit(P2, bang),
  996:     unlink(P3), exit(P3, bang),
  997:     unlink(P4), exit(P4, bang),
  998:     unlink(P5), exit(P5, bang),
  999:     unlink(P6), exit(P6, bang),
 1000:     ok.
 1001: 
 1002: many_args(0,_B,_C,_D,_E,_F,_G,_H,_I,_J) ->
 1003:     ok;
 1004: many_args(A,B,C,D,E,F,G,H,I,J) ->
 1005:     many_args(A-1,B,C,D,E,F,G,H,I,J).
 1006: 
 1007: do_pi_msg_len(PT, AT) ->
 1008:     lists:map(fun (_) -> ok end, [a,b,c,d]),
 1009:     {message_queue_len, _} = process_info(element(2,PT), element(2,AT)).
 1010:     
 1011: process_info_lock_reschedule3(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1012:     %% We need a process that is running and an item that requires
 1013:     %% process_info to take the main process lock.
 1014:     Target1 = spawn_link(fun tok_loop/0),
 1015:     Name1 = process_info_lock_reschedule_running,
 1016:     register(Name1, Target1),
 1017:     Target2 = spawn_link(fun () -> receive after infinity -> ok end end),
 1018:     Name2 = process_info_lock_reschedule_waiting,
 1019:     register(Name2, Target2),
 1020:     PI = fun(N) ->
 1021: 	    case N rem 10 of
 1022: 		0 -> erlang:yield();
 1023: 		_ -> ok
 1024: 	    end,
 1025: 	    do_pi_msg_len({proc, Target1},
 1026: 		{arg, message_queue_len})
 1027:     end,
 1028:     many_args(100000,1,2,3,4,5,6,7,8,9),
 1029:     lists:foreach(PI, lists:seq(1,1000000)),
 1030:     %% Make sure Target1 still is willing to "tok loop"
 1031:     case process_info(Target1, status) of
 1032: 	      {status, OkStatus} when OkStatus == runnable;
 1033: 				      OkStatus == running;
 1034: 				      OkStatus == garbage_collecting ->
 1035: 		  unlink(Target1),
 1036: 		  unlink(Target2),
 1037: 		  exit(Target1, bang),
 1038: 		  exit(Target2, bang),
 1039: 		  OkStatus;
 1040: 	      {status, BadStatus} ->
 1041: 		  ct:fail(BadStatus)
 1042: 	  end.
 1043: 
 1044: otp_4725(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1045:     Tester = self(),
 1046:     Ref1 = make_ref(),
 1047:     Pid1 = spawn_opt(fun () ->
 1048: 		Tester ! {Ref1, process_info(self())},
 1049: 		receive
 1050: 		    Ref1 -> bye
 1051: 		end
 1052: 	end, [link, {priority, max}, {fullsweep_after, 600}]),
 1053:     receive
 1054: 	{Ref1, ProcInfo1A} ->
 1055: 	    ProcInfo1B = process_info(Pid1),
 1056: 	    Pid1 ! Ref1,
 1057: 	    check_proc_infos(ProcInfo1A, ProcInfo1B)
 1058:     end,
 1059:     Ref2 = make_ref(),
 1060:     Pid2 = spawn_opt(fun () ->
 1061: 		Tester ! {Ref2, process_info(self())},
 1062: 		receive
 1063: 		    Ref2 -> bye
 1064: 		end
 1065: 	end,
 1066: 	[]),
 1067:     receive
 1068: 	{Ref2, ProcInfo2A} ->
 1069: 	    ProcInfo2B = process_info(Pid2),
 1070: 	    Pid2 ! Ref2,
 1071: 	    check_proc_infos(ProcInfo2A, ProcInfo2B)
 1072:     end,
 1073:     ok.
 1074: 
 1075: check_proc_infos(A, B) ->
 1076:     IC = lists:keysearch(initial_call, 1, A),
 1077:     IC = lists:keysearch(initial_call, 1, B),
 1078: 
 1079:     L = lists:keysearch(links, 1, A),
 1080:     L = lists:keysearch(links, 1, B),
 1081: 
 1082:     D = lists:keysearch(dictionary, 1, A),
 1083:     D = lists:keysearch(dictionary, 1, B),
 1084: 
 1085:     TE = lists:keysearch(trap_exit, 1, A),
 1086:     TE = lists:keysearch(trap_exit, 1, B),
 1087: 
 1088:     EH = lists:keysearch(error_handler, 1, A),
 1089:     EH = lists:keysearch(error_handler, 1, B),
 1090: 
 1091:     P = lists:keysearch(priority, 1, A),
 1092:     P = lists:keysearch(priority, 1, B),
 1093: 
 1094:     GL = lists:keysearch(group_leader, 1, A),
 1095:     GL = lists:keysearch(group_leader, 1, B),
 1096: 
 1097:     GC = lists:keysearch(garbage_collection, 1, A),
 1098:     GC = lists:keysearch(garbage_collection, 1, B),
 1099:     {value, {garbage_collection, GClist}} = GC,
 1100: 
 1101:     %% This is not really documented
 1102:     true = is_integer(gv(minor_gcs, GClist)),
 1103:     true = is_integer(gv(fullsweep_after, GClist)),
 1104:     true = is_integer(gv(min_heap_size, GClist)),
 1105:     #{error_logger := Bool1,
 1106:       include_shared_binaries := Bool2,
 1107:       kill := Bool3,
 1108:       size := MaxHeapSize} = gv(max_heap_size, GClist),
 1109:     true = is_boolean(Bool1),
 1110:     true = is_boolean(Bool2),
 1111:     true = is_boolean(Bool3),
 1112:     true = is_integer(MaxHeapSize),
 1113: 
 1114:     ok.
 1115:

 1117: %% Dummies.
 1118: 
 1119: start_spawner() ->
 1120:     ok.
 1121: 
 1122: stop_spawner() ->
 1123:     ok.
 1124: 
 1125: %% Tests erlang:process_info(Pid, garbage_collection_info)
 1126: process_info_garbage_collection(_Config) ->
 1127:     Parent = self(),
 1128:     Pid = spawn_link(
 1129:             fun() ->
 1130:                     %% We set mqd to off_heap and send an tuple
 1131:                     %% to process in order to force mbuf_size
 1132:                     %% to be used
 1133:                     process_flag(message_queue_data, off_heap),
 1134:                     receive go -> ok end,
 1135:                     (fun F(0) ->
 1136:                              Parent ! deep,
 1137:                              receive {ok,_} -> ok end,
 1138:                              [];
 1139:                          F(N) ->
 1140:                              timer:sleep(1),
 1141:                              [lists:seq(1,100) | F(N-1)]
 1142:                      end)(1000),
 1143:                     Parent ! shallow,
 1144:                     receive done -> ok end
 1145:             end),
 1146:     [{garbage_collection_info, Before},{total_heap_size, THSBefore}] =
 1147:         erlang:process_info(Pid, [garbage_collection_info, total_heap_size]),
 1148:     Pid ! go, receive deep -> ok end,
 1149:     [{_, Deep},{_,THSDeep}]  =
 1150:          erlang:process_info(Pid, [garbage_collection_info, total_heap_size]),
 1151:     Pid ! {ok, make_ref()}, receive shallow -> ok end,
 1152:     [{_, After},{_, THSAfter}] =
 1153:         erlang:process_info(Pid, [garbage_collection_info, total_heap_size]),
 1154:     Pid ! done,
 1155: 
 1156:     %% Do some general checks to see if everything seems to be roughly correct
 1157:     ct:log("Before: ~p",[Before]),
 1158:     ct:log("Deep: ~p",[Deep]),
 1159:     ct:log("After: ~p",[After]),
 1160:     ct:log("Before THS: ~p",[THSBefore]),
 1161:     ct:log("Deep THS: ~p",[THSDeep]),
 1162:     ct:log("After THS: ~p",[THSAfter]),
 1163: 
 1164:     %% Check stack_size
 1165:     true = gv(stack_size, Before) < gv(stack_size, Deep),
 1166:     true = gv(stack_size, After) < gv(stack_size, Deep),
 1167: 
 1168:     %% Check used heap size
 1169:     true = gv(heap_size, Before) + gv(old_heap_size, Before)
 1170:         < gv(heap_size, Deep) + gv(old_heap_size, Deep),
 1171:     true = gv(heap_size, Before) + gv(old_heap_size, Before)
 1172:         < gv(heap_size, After) + gv(old_heap_size, After),
 1173: 
 1174:     %% Check that total_heap_size == heap_block_size + old_heap_block_size + mbuf_size
 1175:     THSBefore = gv(heap_block_size, Before)
 1176:         + gv(old_heap_block_size, Before)
 1177:         + gv(mbuf_size, Before),
 1178: 
 1179:     THSDeep = gv(heap_block_size, Deep)
 1180:         + gv(old_heap_block_size, Deep)
 1181:         + gv(mbuf_size, Deep),
 1182: 
 1183:     THSAfter = gv(heap_block_size, After)
 1184:         + gv(old_heap_block_size, After)
 1185:         + gv(mbuf_size, After),
 1186: 
 1187:     ok.
 1188: 
 1189: gv(Key,List) ->
 1190:     proplists:get_value(Key,List).
 1191: 
 1192: process_info_parent(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1193:     Child = spawn_link(fun () -> receive stop -> ok end end),
 1194:     ?assertEqual({parent, self()}, erlang:process_info(Child, parent)),
 1195:     Child ! stop,
 1196:     ?assertEqual({parent, undefined}, erlang:process_info(whereis(init), parent)),
 1197: 
 1198:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(),
 1199:     RemoteChild = spawn_link(Node,
 1200:                              fun () ->
 1201:                                      {parent, Parent} = process_info(self(), parent),
 1202:                                      garbage_collect(),
 1203:                                      {parent, Parent} = process_info(self(), parent),
 1204:                                      garbage_collect(),
 1205:                                      Parent ! remote_child_hello,
 1206:                                      receive stop -> ok end
 1207:                              end),
 1208:     ?assertEqual({parent, self()},
 1209:                  erpc:call(Node, erlang, process_info, [RemoteChild, parent])),
 1210:     receive remote_child_hello -> ok end,
 1211:     unlink(RemoteChild),
 1212:     RemoteChild ! stop,
 1213:     peer:stop(Peer),
 1214:     ok.
 1215: 
 1216: process_info_smoke_all_tester() ->
 1217:     register(process_info_smoke_all_tester, self()),
 1218:     put(ets_ref, ets:new(blupp, [])),
 1219:     put(binary, [list_to_binary(lists:duplicate(1000, 1)),
 1220:                  list_to_binary(lists:duplicate(1000, 2))]),
 1221:     process_info_smoke_all_tester_loop().
 1222: 
 1223: process_info_smoke_all_tester_loop() ->
 1224:     receive
 1225:         {other_process, Pid} ->
 1226:             case get(procs) of
 1227:                 undefined -> put(procs, [Pid]);
 1228:                 Procs -> put(procs, [Pid|Procs])
 1229:             end,
 1230:             erlang:monitor(process, Pid),
 1231:             link(Pid),
 1232:             process_info_smoke_all_tester_loop()
 1233:     end.
 1234: 
 1235: process_info_smoke_all(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1236:     AllPIOptions = [registered_name,
 1237:                     current_function,
 1238:                     initial_call,
 1239:                     messages,
 1240:                     message_queue_len,
 1241:                     links,
 1242:                     monitors,
 1243:                     monitored_by,
 1244:                     dictionary,
 1245:                     trap_exit,
 1246:                     error_handler,
 1247:                     heap_size,
 1248:                     stack_size,
 1249:                     memory,
 1250:                     garbage_collection,
 1251:                     group_leader,
 1252:                     reductions,
 1253:                     priority,
 1254:                     trace,
 1255:                     binary,
 1256:                     sequential_trace_token,
 1257:                     catchlevel,
 1258:                     backtrace,
 1259:                     last_calls,
 1260:                     total_heap_size,
 1261:                     suspending,
 1262:                     min_heap_size,
 1263:                     min_bin_vheap_size,
 1264:                     max_heap_size,
 1265:                     current_location,
 1266:                     current_stacktrace,
 1267:                     message_queue_data,
 1268:                     garbage_collection_info,
 1269:                     magic_ref,
 1270:                     fullsweep_after,
 1271:                     {dictionary, ets_ref}],
 1272: 
 1273:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(),
 1274:     RP = spawn_link(Node, fun process_info_smoke_all_tester/0),
 1275:     LP = spawn_link(fun process_info_smoke_all_tester/0),
 1276:     RP ! {other_process, LP},
 1277:     LP ! {other_process, RP},
 1278:     LP ! {other_process, self()},
 1279:     LP ! ets:new(blapp, []),
 1280:     LP ! ets:new(blipp, []),
 1281:     LP ! list_to_binary(lists:duplicate(1000, 3)),
 1282:     receive after 1000 -> ok end,
 1283:     _MLP = erlang:monitor(process, LP),
 1284:     true = is_process_alive(LP),
 1285:     PI = process_info(LP, AllPIOptions),
 1286:     io:format("~p~n", [PI]),
 1287:     garbage_collect(),
 1288:     unlink(RP),
 1289:     unlink(LP),
 1290:     exit(RP, kill),
 1291:     exit(LP, kill),
 1292:     false = is_process_alive(LP),
 1293:     stop_node(Peer, Node),
 1294:     ok.
 1295: 
 1296: process_info_status_handled_signal(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1297:     P = spawn_link(fun () ->
 1298:                            receive after infinity -> ok end
 1299:                    end),
 1300:     wait_until(fun () ->
 1301:                        process_info(P, status) == {status, waiting}
 1302:                end),
 1303:     %%
 1304:     %% The 'messages' option will force a process-info-request
 1305:     %% signal to be scheduled on the process. Ensure that status
 1306:     %% 'waiting' is reported even though it is actually running
 1307:     %% when handling the request. We want it to report the status
 1308:     %% it would have had if it had not been handling the
 1309:     %% process-info-request...
 1310:     %%
 1311:     [{status, waiting}, {messages, []}] = process_info(P, [status, messages]),
 1312:     unlink(P),
 1313:     exit(P, kill),
 1314:     false = erlang:is_process_alive(P),
 1315:     ok.
 1316: 
 1317: %% OTP-15709
 1318: %% Provoke a bug where process_info(reductions) returned wrong result
 1319: %% because REDS_IN (def_arg_reg[5]) is read when the process in not running.
 1320: %%
 1321: %% And a bug where process_info(reductions) on a process which was releasing its
 1322: %% main lock during execution could result in negative reduction diffs.
 1323: process_info_reductions(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1324:     {S1, S2} = case erlang:system_info(schedulers_online) of
 1325:                    1 -> {1,1};
 1326:                    _ -> {1,2}
 1327:                end,
 1328:     io:format("Run on schedulers ~p and ~p\n", [S1,S2]),
 1329:     Boss = self(),
 1330:     Doer = spawn_opt(fun () ->
 1331:                              pi_reductions_tester(true, 10, fun pi_reductions_spinnloop/0, S2),
 1332:                              pi_reductions_tester(true, 10, fun pi_reductions_recvloop/0, S2),
 1333:                              pi_reductions_tester(false, 100, fun pi_reductions_main_unlocker/0, S2),
 1334:                              Boss ! {self(), done}
 1335:                      end,
 1336:                      [link, {scheduler, S1}]),
 1337: 
 1338:     {Doer, done} = receive M -> M end,
 1339:     ok.
 1340: 
 1341: pi_reductions_tester(ForceSignal, MaxCalls, Fun, S2) ->
 1342:     Pid = spawn_opt(Fun, [link, {scheduler,S2}]),
 1343:     Extra = case ForceSignal of
 1344:                 true ->
 1345:                     %% Add another item that force sending the request
 1346:                     %% as a signal, like 'current_function'.
 1347:                     [current_function];
 1348:                 false ->
 1349:                     []
 1350:             end,
 1351:     LoopFun = fun Me(Calls, Prev, Acc0) ->
 1352:                       PI = process_info(Pid, [reductions | Extra]),
 1353:                       [{reductions,Reds} | _] = PI,
 1354:                       Diff = Reds - Prev,
 1355:                       %% Verify we get sane non-negative reduction diffs
 1356:                       {Diff, true} = {Diff, (Diff >= 0)},
 1357:                       {Diff, true} = {Diff, (Diff =< 1000*1000)},
 1358:                       Acc1 = [Diff | Acc0],
 1359:                       case Calls >= MaxCalls of
 1360:                           true -> Acc1;
 1361:                           false -> Me(Calls+1, Reds, Acc1)
 1362:                       end
 1363:               end,
 1364:     DiffList = LoopFun(0, 0, []),
 1365:     unlink(Pid),
 1366:     exit(Pid,kill),
 1367:     io:format("Reduction diffs: ~p\n", [lists:reverse(DiffList)]),
 1368:     ok.
 1369: 
 1370: pi_reductions_spinnloop() ->
 1371:     %% 6 args to make use of def_arg_reg[5] which is also used as REDS_IN
 1372:     pi_reductions_spinnloop(999*1000, atom, "hej", self(), make_ref(), 3.14).
 1373: 
 1374: pi_reductions_spinnloop(N,A,B,C,D,E) when N > 0 ->
 1375:     pi_reductions_spinnloop(N-1,B,C,D,E,A);
 1376: pi_reductions_spinnloop(0,_,_,_,_,_) ->
 1377:     %% Stop to limit max number of reductions consumed
 1378:     pi_reductions_recvloop().
 1379: 
 1380: pi_reductions_recvloop() ->
 1381:     receive
 1382:         "a free lunch" -> false
 1383:     end.
 1384: 
 1385: pi_reductions_main_unlocker() ->
 1386:     Other = spawn_link(fun() -> receive die -> ok end end),
 1387:     pi_reductions_main_unlocker_loop(Other).
 1388: 
 1389: pi_reductions_main_unlocker_loop(Other) ->
 1390:     %% Assumption: register(OtherPid, Name) will unlock main lock of calling
 1391:     %% process during execution.
 1392:     register(pi_reductions_main_unlocker, Other),
 1393:     unregister(pi_reductions_main_unlocker),
 1394: 
 1395:     %% Yield in order to increase probability of process_info sometimes probing
 1396:     %% this process when it's not RUNNING.
 1397:     erlang:yield(),
 1398:     pi_reductions_main_unlocker_loop(Other).
 1399: 
 1400: process_info_self_signal(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1401:     %% Test that signals that we have sent to ourselves are
 1402:     %% visible in process_info() result. This is not strictly
 1403:     %% a necessary property, but implemented so now. See
 1404:     %% process_info.c:process_info_bif() for more info.
 1405:     Self = self(),
 1406:     Ref = make_ref(),
 1407:     pi_sig_spam_test(fun () ->
 1408:                              process_info_self_signal_spammer(Self)
 1409:                      end,
 1410:                      fun () ->
 1411:                              self() ! Ref,
 1412:                              process_info(self(), messages)
 1413:                      end,
 1414:                      fun (Res) ->
 1415:                              {messages, [Ref]} = Res
 1416:                      end).
 1417: 
 1418: process_info_self_signal_spammer(To) ->
 1419:     erlang:demonitor(erlang:monitor(process, To)),
 1420:     process_info_self_signal_spammer(To).
 1421: 
 1422: process_info_self_msgq_len(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1423:     %% Spam ourselves with signals forcing us to flush own
 1424:     %% signal queue..
 1425:     Self = self(),
 1426:     pi_sig_spam_test(fun () ->
 1427:                              process_info_self_msgq_len_spammer(Self)
 1428:                      end,
 1429:                      fun () ->
 1430:                              process_info(self(), message_queue_len)
 1431:                      end,
 1432:                      fun (Res) ->
 1433:                              {message_queue_len, Len} = Res,
 1434:                              true = Len > 0,
 1435:                              ok
 1436:                      end).
 1437: 
 1438: 
 1439: process_info_self_msgq_len_messages(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1440:     %% Spam ourselves with signals normally forcing us to flush own
 1441:     %% signal queue, but since we also want messages wont be flushed...
 1442:     Self = self(),
 1443:     pi_sig_spam_test(fun () ->
 1444:                              process_info_self_msgq_len_spammer(Self, 100000)
 1445:                      end,
 1446:                      fun () ->
 1447:                              process_info(self(),
 1448:                                           [message_queue_len,
 1449:                                            messages])
 1450:                      end,
 1451:                      fun (Res) ->
 1452:                              [{message_queue_len, Len},
 1453:                               {messages, Msgs}] = Res,
 1454:                              Len = length(Msgs),
 1455:                              ok
 1456:                      end).
 1457: 
 1458: process_info_self_msgq_len_more(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1459:     self() ! hej,
 1460:     BodyRes = process_info_self_msgq_len_more_caller_body(),
 1461:     ok = process_info_self_msgq_len_more_caller_body_result(BodyRes),
 1462:     TailRes = process_info_self_msgq_len_more_caller_tail(),
 1463:     ok = process_info_self_msgq_len_more_caller_tail_result(TailRes),
 1464:     receive hej -> ok end,
 1465:     %% Check that current_function, current_location, and
 1466:     %% current_stacktrace give sane results flushing or not...
 1467:     Self = self(),
 1468:     pi_sig_spam_test(fun () ->
 1469:                              process_info_self_msgq_len_spammer(Self)
 1470:                      end,
 1471:                      fun process_info_self_msgq_len_more_caller_body/0,
 1472:                      fun process_info_self_msgq_len_more_caller_body_result/1),
 1473:     pi_sig_spam_test(fun () ->
 1474:                              process_info_self_msgq_len_spammer(Self)
 1475:                      end,
 1476:                      fun process_info_self_msgq_len_more_caller_tail/0,
 1477:                      fun process_info_self_msgq_len_more_caller_tail_result/1).
 1478: 
 1479: process_info_self_msgq_len_more_caller_body() ->
 1480:     Res = process_info(self(),
 1481:                        [message_queue_len,
 1482:                         current_function,
 1483:                         current_location,
 1484:                         current_stacktrace]),
 1485:     id(Res).
 1486: 
 1487: process_info_self_msgq_len_more_caller_body_result(Res) ->
 1488:     [{message_queue_len, Len},
 1489:      {current_function, {process_SUITE,process_info_self_msgq_len_more_caller_body,0}},
 1490:      {current_location, {process_SUITE,process_info_self_msgq_len_more_caller_body,0,_}},
 1491:      {current_stacktrace,
 1492:       [{process_SUITE,process_info_self_msgq_len_more_caller_body,0,_} | _]}] = Res,
 1493:     true = Len > 0,
 1494:     ok.
 1495: 
 1496: process_info_self_msgq_len_more_caller_tail() ->
 1497:     process_info(self(),
 1498:                  [message_queue_len,
 1499:                   current_function,
 1500:                   current_location,
 1501:                   current_stacktrace]).
 1502: 
 1503: process_info_self_msgq_len_more_caller_tail_result(Res) ->
 1504:     [{message_queue_len, Len},
 1505:      {current_function, {process_SUITE,process_info_self_msgq_len_more_caller_tail,0}},
 1506:      {current_location, {process_SUITE,process_info_self_msgq_len_more_caller_tail,0,_}},
 1507:      {current_stacktrace,
 1508:       [{process_SUITE,process_info_self_msgq_len_more_caller_tail,0,_} | _]}] = Res,
 1509:     true = Len > 0,
 1510:     ok.
 1511:     
 1512: 
 1513: process_info_self_msgq_len_spammer(To) ->
 1514:     process_info_self_msgq_len_spammer(To, 10000000).
 1515: 
 1516: process_info_self_msgq_len_spammer(_To, 0) ->
 1517:     ok;
 1518: process_info_self_msgq_len_spammer(To, N) ->
 1519:     To ! hejhopp,
 1520:     erlang:demonitor(erlang:monitor(process, To)),
 1521:     process_info_self_msgq_len_spammer(To, N-1).
 1522: 
 1523: pi_sig_spam_test(SpamFun, PITest, PICheckRes) ->
 1524:     SO = erlang:system_flag(schedulers_online, 1),
 1525:     try
 1526:         Self = self(),
 1527:         SigSpammer = spawn_link(SpamFun),
 1528:         process_flag(priority, low),
 1529:         receive after 10 -> ok end,
 1530:         Res = PITest(),
 1531:         process_flag(priority, high),
 1532:         unlink(SigSpammer),
 1533:         exit(SigSpammer, kill),
 1534:         false = is_process_alive(SigSpammer),
 1535:         PICheckRes(Res)
 1536:     after
 1537:         _ = erlang:system_flag(schedulers_online, SO)
 1538:     end.
 1539: 
 1540: process_info_msgq_len_no_very_long_delay(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1541:     Tester = self(),
 1542:     P1 = spawn_link(fun () ->
 1543:                             receive after infinity -> ok end
 1544:                     end),
 1545:     {message_queue_len, 0} = process_info(self(), message_queue_len),
 1546:     {message_queue_len, 0} = process_info(P1, message_queue_len),
 1547:     P2 = spawn_link(fun () ->
 1548:                             Tester ! hello,
 1549:                             P1 ! hello,
 1550:                             receive after infinity -> ok end
 1551:                     end),
 1552:     receive after 100 -> ok end,
 1553:     {message_queue_len, 1} = process_info(self(), message_queue_len),
 1554:     {message_queue_len, 1} = process_info(P1, message_queue_len),
 1555:     receive hello -> ok end,
 1556:     {message_queue_len, 0} = process_info(self(), message_queue_len),
 1557:     unlink(P1),
 1558:     exit(P1, kill),
 1559:     unlink(P2),
 1560:     exit(P2, kill),
 1561:     false = is_process_alive(P1),
 1562:     false = is_process_alive(P2),
 1563:     ok.
 1564: 
 1565: process_info_dict_lookup(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1566:     Pid = spawn_link(fun proc_dict_helper/0),
 1567:     {async_dist, AsyncDist} = process_info(Pid, async_dist),
 1568:     Ref = make_ref(),
 1569:     Bin = <<17:4096>>,
 1570:     Int0 = 9999999999999999999999999999999999,
 1571:     Int1 = 1111111111111111111111111111111111,
 1572:     Tuple = {make_ref(), erlang:monotonic_time()},
 1573: 
 1574:     %% Check that we can lookup dictionary values on another process...
 1575:     pdh(Pid, put_async, [hej, hopp]),
 1576:     pdh(Pid, put_async, [hopp, hej]),
 1577:     pdh(Pid, put_async, [Ref, Int0]),
 1578:     pdh(Pid, put_async, [Int0, Int1]),
 1579:     pdh(Pid, put_async, [Pid, Ref]),
 1580:     pdh(Pid, put_async, [Tuple, Bin]),
 1581:     undefined = pdh(Pid, put, [Bin, Ref]),
 1582: 
 1583:     erlang:garbage_collect(Pid),
 1584: 
 1585:     {{dictionary, Ref}, Int0} = process_info(Pid, {dictionary, Ref}),
 1586:     [{{dictionary, Ref}, Int0}] = process_info(Pid, [{dictionary, Ref}]),
 1587: 
 1588:     PIRes = process_info(Pid, [async_dist,
 1589:                                trap_exit,
 1590:                                {dictionary, hej},
 1591:                                {dictionary, hopp},
 1592:                                {dictionary, Ref},
 1593:                                {dictionary, Int0},
 1594:                                async_dist,
 1595:                                trap_exit,
 1596:                                {dictionary, Pid},
 1597:                                {dictionary, Tuple},
 1598:                                {dictionary, Bin}]),
 1599:     ct:log("PIRes = ~p", [PIRes]),
 1600:     PIRes = [{async_dist, AsyncDist},
 1601:              {trap_exit, false},
 1602:              {{dictionary, hej}, hopp},
 1603:              {{dictionary, hopp}, hej},
 1604:              {{dictionary, Ref}, Int0},
 1605:              {{dictionary, Int0}, Int1},
 1606:              {async_dist, AsyncDist},
 1607:              {trap_exit, false},
 1608:              {{dictionary, Pid}, Ref},
 1609:              {{dictionary, Tuple}, Bin},
 1610:              {{dictionary, Bin}, Ref}],
 1611: 
 1612:     pdh(Pid, erase_async, [hej]),
 1613:     pdh(Pid, erase_async, [hopp]),
 1614:     pdh(Pid, erase_async, [Ref]),
 1615:     pdh(Pid, erase_async, [Int0]),
 1616:     pdh(Pid, erase_async, [Pid]),
 1617:     pdh(Pid, erase_async, [Tuple]),
 1618:     Ref = pdh(Pid, erase, [Bin]),
 1619: 
 1620:     erlang:garbage_collect(Pid),
 1621: 
 1622:     {{dictionary, Ref}, undefined} = process_info(Pid, {dictionary, Ref}),
 1623:     [{{dictionary, Ref}, undefined}] = process_info(Pid, [{dictionary, Ref}]),
 1624: 
 1625:     PIRes2 = process_info(Pid, [async_dist,
 1626:                                 trap_exit,
 1627:                                 {dictionary, hej},
 1628:                                 {dictionary, hopp},
 1629:                                 {dictionary, Ref},
 1630:                                 {dictionary, Int0},
 1631:                                 async_dist,
 1632:                                 trap_exit,
 1633:                                 {dictionary, Pid},
 1634:                                 {dictionary, Tuple},
 1635:                                 {dictionary, Bin}]),
 1636:     ct:log("PIRes2 = ~p", [PIRes2]),
 1637: 
 1638:     PIRes2 = [{async_dist, AsyncDist},
 1639:              {trap_exit, false},
 1640:              {{dictionary, hej}, undefined},
 1641:              {{dictionary, hopp}, undefined},
 1642:              {{dictionary, Ref}, undefined},
 1643:              {{dictionary, Int0}, undefined},
 1644:              {async_dist, AsyncDist},
 1645:              {trap_exit, false},
 1646:              {{dictionary, Pid}, undefined},
 1647:              {{dictionary, Tuple}, undefined},
 1648:              {{dictionary, Bin}, undefined}],
 1649: 
 1650:     unlink(Pid),
 1651:     exit(Pid,kill),
 1652: 
 1653:     %% Also check that it works on ourself...
 1654: 
 1655:     put(hej, hopp),
 1656:     put(hopp, hej),
 1657:     put(Ref, Int0),
 1658:     put(Int0, Int1),
 1659:     put(Pid, Ref),
 1660:     put(Tuple, Bin),
 1661:     undefined = put(Bin, Ref),
 1662: 
 1663:     erlang:garbage_collect(),
 1664: 
 1665:     {{dictionary, Ref}, Int0} = process_info(self(), {dictionary, Ref}),
 1666:     [{{dictionary, Ref}, Int0}] = process_info(self(), [{dictionary, Ref}]),
 1667: 
 1668:     PIRes3 = process_info(self(), [async_dist,
 1669:                                    trap_exit,
 1670:                                    {dictionary, hej},
 1671:                                    {dictionary, hopp},
 1672:                                    {dictionary, Ref},
 1673:                                    {dictionary, Int0},
 1674:                                    async_dist,
 1675:                                    trap_exit,
 1676:                                    {dictionary, Pid},
 1677:                                    {dictionary, Tuple},
 1678:                                    {dictionary, Bin}]),
 1679:     ct:log("PIRes3 = ~p", [PIRes3]),
 1680:     PIRes3 = [{async_dist, AsyncDist},
 1681:               {trap_exit, false},
 1682:               {{dictionary, hej}, hopp},
 1683:               {{dictionary, hopp}, hej},
 1684:               {{dictionary, Ref}, Int0},
 1685:               {{dictionary, Int0}, Int1},
 1686:               {async_dist, AsyncDist},
 1687:               {trap_exit, false},
 1688:               {{dictionary, Pid}, Ref},
 1689:               {{dictionary, Tuple}, Bin},
 1690:               {{dictionary, Bin}, Ref}],
 1691: 
 1692:     erase(hej),
 1693:     erase(hopp),
 1694:     erase(Ref),
 1695:     erase(Int0),
 1696:     erase(Pid),
 1697:     erase(Tuple),
 1698:     Ref = erase(Bin),
 1699: 
 1700:     erlang:garbage_collect(),
 1701: 
 1702:     {{dictionary, Ref}, undefined} = process_info(self(), {dictionary, Ref}),
 1703:     [{{dictionary, Ref}, undefined}] = process_info(self(), [{dictionary, Ref}]),
 1704: 
 1705:     PIRes4 = process_info(self(), [async_dist,
 1706:                                    trap_exit,
 1707:                                    {dictionary, hej},
 1708:                                    {dictionary, hopp},
 1709:                                    {dictionary, Ref},
 1710:                                    {dictionary, Int0},
 1711:                                    async_dist,
 1712:                                    trap_exit,
 1713:                                    {dictionary, Pid},
 1714:                                    {dictionary, Tuple},
 1715:                                    {dictionary, Bin}]),
 1716:     ct:log("PIRes4 = ~p", [PIRes4]),
 1717: 
 1718:     PIRes4 = [{async_dist, AsyncDist},
 1719:               {trap_exit, false},
 1720:               {{dictionary, hej}, undefined},
 1721:               {{dictionary, hopp}, undefined},
 1722:               {{dictionary, Ref}, undefined},
 1723:               {{dictionary, Int0}, undefined},
 1724:               {async_dist, AsyncDist},
 1725:               {trap_exit, false},
 1726:               {{dictionary, Pid}, undefined},
 1727:               {{dictionary, Tuple}, undefined},
 1728:               {{dictionary, Bin}, undefined}],
 1729: 
 1730:     false = is_process_alive(Pid),
 1731:     ok.
 1732: 
 1733: pdh(Pid, AsyncOp, Args) when AsyncOp == put_async;
 1734:                              AsyncOp == erase_async ->
 1735:     Pid ! {AsyncOp, Args},
 1736:     ok;
 1737: pdh(Pid, SyncOp, Args) ->
 1738:     Ref = make_ref(),
 1739:     Pid ! {SyncOp, self(), Ref, Args},
 1740:     receive {Ref, Res} -> Res end.
 1741: 
 1742: proc_dict_helper() ->
 1743:     receive
 1744:         {put, From, Ref, [Key, Value]} ->
 1745:             From ! {Ref, put(Key, Value)};
 1746:         {get, From, Ref, [Key]} ->
 1747:             From ! {Ref, get(Key)};
 1748:         {get, From, Ref, []} ->
 1749:             From ! {Ref, get()};
 1750:         {erase, From, Ref, [Key]} ->
 1751:             From ! {Ref, erase(Key)};
 1752:         {put_async, [Key, Value]} ->
 1753:             _ = put(Key, Value);
 1754:         {erase_async, [Key]} ->
 1755:             _ = erase(Key)
 1756:     end,
 1757:     proc_dict_helper().
 1758: 
 1759: %% Tests erlang:bump_reductions/1.
 1760: bump_reductions(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1761:     erlang:garbage_collect(),
 1762:     erlang:yield(),		% Clear reductions.
 1763:     {reductions,R1} = process_info(self(), reductions),
 1764:     true = erlang:bump_reductions(100),
 1765:     {reductions,R2} = process_info(self(), reductions),
 1766:     case R2-R1 of
 1767: 	      Diff when Diff < 100 ->
 1768: 		  ok = io:format("R1 = ~w, R2 = ~w", [R1, R2]),
 1769: 		  ct:fail({small_diff, Diff});
 1770: 	      Diff when Diff > 110 ->
 1771: 		  ok = io:format("R1 = ~w, R2 = ~w", [R1, R2]),
 1772: 		  ct:fail({big_diff, Diff});
 1773: 	      Diff ->
 1774: 		  io:format("~p\n", [Diff]),
 1775: 		  ok
 1776: 	  end,
 1777: 
 1778:     %% Make sure that a bignum reduction doesn't crash the emulator (32-bit CPU).
 1779:     bump_big(R2, 16#08000000).
 1780: 
 1781: bump_big(Prev, Limit) ->
 1782:     true = erlang:bump_reductions(100000), %Limited to CONTEXT_REDUCTIONS.
 1783:     case process_info(self(), reductions) of
 1784: 	      {reductions,Big} when is_integer(Big), Big > Limit ->
 1785: 		  erlang:garbage_collect(),
 1786: 		  io:format("~p\n", [Big]);
 1787: 	      {reductions,R} when is_integer(R), R > Prev ->
 1788: 		  bump_big(R, Limit)
 1789: 	  end,
 1790:     ok.
 1791: 
 1792: %% Priority 'low' should be mixed with 'normal' using a factor of
 1793: %% about 8. (OTP-2644)
 1794: low_prio(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1795:     erlang:system_flag(multi_scheduling, block_normal),
 1796:     Prop = low_prio_test(Config),
 1797:     erlang:system_flag(multi_scheduling, unblock_normal),
 1798:     Str = lists:flatten(io_lib:format("Low/high proportion is ~.3f",
 1799:                                       [Prop])),
 1800:     {comment,Str}.
 1801: 
 1802: low_prio_test(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1803:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
 1804: 
 1805:     %% Spawn the server running with high priority. The server must
 1806:     %% not run at normal priority as that would skew the results for
 1807:     %% two reasons:
 1808:     %%
 1809:     %% 1. There would be one more normal-priority processes than
 1810:     %% low-priority processes.
 1811:     %%
 1812:     %% 2. The receive queue would grow faster than the server process
 1813:     %% could process it. That would in turn trigger the reduction
 1814:     %% punishment for the clients.
 1815:     S = spawn_opt(?MODULE, prio_server, [0, 0], [link,{priority,high}]),
 1816: 
 1817:     %% Spawn the clients and let them run for a while.
 1818:     PCs = spawn_prio_clients(S, erlang:system_info(schedulers_online)),
 1819:     ct:sleep({seconds,2}),
 1820:     lists:foreach(fun (P) -> exit(P, kill) end, PCs),
 1821: 
 1822:     %% Stop the server and retrieve the result.
 1823:     S ! exit,
 1824:     receive
 1825:         {'EXIT', S, {A, B}} ->
 1826:             check_prio(A, B)
 1827:     end.
 1828: 
 1829: check_prio(A, B) ->
 1830:     Prop = A/B,
 1831:     ok = io:format("Low=~p, High=~p, Prop=~p\n", [A, B, Prop]),
 1832: 
 1833:     %% Prop is expected to be appr. 1/8. Allow a reasonable margin.
 1834:     true = Prop < 1/4,
 1835:     true = Prop > 1/16,
 1836:     Prop.
 1837: 
 1838: prio_server(A, B) ->
 1839:     receive
 1840: 	low ->
 1841: 	    prio_server(A+1, B);
 1842: 	normal ->
 1843: 	    prio_server(A, B+1);
 1844: 	exit ->
 1845: 	    exit({A, B})
 1846:     end.
 1847: 
 1848: spawn_prio_clients(_, 0) ->
 1849:     [];
 1850: spawn_prio_clients(S, N) ->
 1851:     [spawn_opt(?MODULE, prio_client, [S, normal], [link, {priority,normal}]),
 1852:      spawn_opt(?MODULE, prio_client, [S, low], [link, {priority,low}])
 1853:      | spawn_prio_clients(S, N-1)].
 1854: 
 1855: prio_client(S, Prio) ->
 1856:     S ! Prio,
 1857:     prio_client(S, Prio).
 1858: 
 1859: make_sub_binary(Bin) when is_binary(Bin) ->
 1860:     {_,B} = split_binary(list_to_binary([0,1,3,Bin]), 3),
 1861:     B;
 1862: make_sub_binary(List) ->
 1863:     make_sub_binary(list_to_binary(List)).
 1864: 
 1865: make_unaligned_sub_binary(Bin0) ->
 1866:     Bin1 = <<0:3,Bin0/binary,31:5>>,
 1867:     Sz = size(Bin0),
 1868:     <<0:3,Bin:Sz/binary,31:5>> = id(Bin1),
 1869:     Bin.
 1870: 
 1871: %% Tests erlang:yield/1
 1872: yield(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1873:     case catch erlang:system_info(modified_timing_level) of
 1874: 	Level when is_integer(Level) ->
 1875: 	    {skipped,
 1876: 	     "Modified timing (level " ++ integer_to_list(Level)
 1877: 	     ++ ") is enabled. Testcase gets messed up by modified "
 1878: 	     "timing."};
 1879: 	_ ->
 1880: 	    MS = erlang:system_flag(multi_scheduling, block_normal),
 1881: 	    yield_test(),
 1882: 	    erlang:system_flag(multi_scheduling, unblock_normal),
 1883: 	    case MS of
 1884: 		blocked ->
 1885: 		    {comment,
 1886: 		     "Multi-scheduling blocked during test. This test-case "
 1887: 		     "was not written to work with multiple schedulers (the "
 1888: 		     "yield2 test-case tests almost the same thing)."};
 1889: 		_ ->
 1890: 		    ok
 1891: 	    end
 1892:     end.
 1893: 
 1894: yield_test() ->
 1895:     erlang:garbage_collect(),
 1896:     receive after 1 -> ok end,		% Clear reductions.
 1897:     SC = schedcnt(start),
 1898:     {reductions, R1} = process_info(self(), reductions),
 1899:     {ok, true} = call_yield(middle),
 1900:     true = call_yield(final),
 1901:     true = call_yield(),
 1902:     true = apply(erlang, yield, []),
 1903:     {reductions, R2} = process_info(self(), reductions),
 1904:     Schedcnt = schedcnt(stop, SC),
 1905:     case {R2-R1, Schedcnt} of
 1906: 	{Diff, 4} when Diff < 30 ->
 1907: 	    ok = io:format("R1 = ~w, R2 = ~w, Schedcnt = ~w", 
 1908: 		[R1, R2, Schedcnt]);
 1909: 	{Diff, _} ->
 1910: 	    ok = io:format("R1 = ~w, R2 = ~w, Schedcnt = ~w", 
 1911: 		[R1, R2, Schedcnt]),
 1912: 	    ct:fail({measurement_error, Diff, Schedcnt})
 1913:     end.
 1914: 
 1915: call_yield() ->
 1916:     erlang:yield().
 1917: 
 1918: call_yield(middle) ->
 1919:     {ok, erlang:yield()};
 1920: call_yield(final) ->
 1921:     case self() of
 1922: 	Self when is_pid(Self) ->
 1923: 	    ok
 1924:     end,
 1925:     erlang:yield().
 1926: 
 1927: schedcnt(start) ->
 1928:     Ref = make_ref(),
 1929:     Fun = 
 1930: 	fun (F, Cnt) ->
 1931: 		receive
 1932: 		    {Ref, Parent} ->
 1933: 			Parent ! {Ref, Cnt}
 1934: 		after 0 ->
 1935: 			erlang:yield(),
 1936: 			F(F, Cnt+1)
 1937: 		end
 1938: 	end,
 1939:     Pid = spawn_link(fun () -> Fun(Fun, 0) end),
 1940:     {Ref, Pid}.
 1941: 
 1942: schedcnt(stop, {Ref, Pid}) when is_reference(Ref), is_pid(Pid) ->
 1943:     Pid ! {Ref, self()},
 1944:     receive
 1945: 	{Ref, Cnt} ->
 1946: 	    Cnt
 1947:     end.
 1948: 
 1949: yield2(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1950:     Me = self(),
 1951:     Go = make_ref(),
 1952:     RedDiff = make_ref(),
 1953:     Done = make_ref(),
 1954:     P = spawn(fun () ->
 1955: 		receive Go -> ok end,
 1956: 		{reductions, R1} = process_info(self(), reductions),
 1957: 		{ok, true} = call_yield(middle),
 1958: 		true = call_yield(final),
 1959: 		true = call_yield(),
 1960: 		true = apply(erlang, yield, []),
 1961: 		{reductions, R2} = process_info(self(), reductions),
 1962: 		Me ! {RedDiff, R2 - R1},
 1963: 		exit(Done)
 1964: 	end),
 1965:     erlang:yield(),
 1966: 
 1967:     1 = erlang:trace(P, true, [running, procs, {tracer, self()}]),
 1968: 
 1969:     P ! Go,
 1970: 
 1971:     %% receive Go -> ok end,
 1972:     {trace, P, in, _} = next_tmsg(P),
 1973: 
 1974:     %% {ok, true} = call_yield(middle),
 1975:     {trace, P, out, _} = next_tmsg(P),
 1976:     {trace, P, in, _} = next_tmsg(P),
 1977: 
 1978:     %% true = call_yield(final),
 1979:     {trace, P, out, _} = next_tmsg(P),
 1980:     {trace, P, in, _} = next_tmsg(P),
 1981: 
 1982:     %% true = call_yield(),
 1983:     {trace, P, out, _} = next_tmsg(P),
 1984:     {trace, P, in, _} = next_tmsg(P),
 1985: 
 1986:     %% true = apply(erlang, yield, []),
 1987:     {trace, P, out, _} = next_tmsg(P),
 1988:     {trace, P, in, _} = next_tmsg(P),
 1989: 
 1990:     %% exit(Done)
 1991:     {trace, P, exit, Done} = next_tmsg(P),
 1992: 
 1993: 
 1994:     receive
 1995: 	      {RedDiff, Reductions} when Reductions < 30, Reductions > 0 ->
 1996: 		  io:format("Reductions = ~p~n", [Reductions]),
 1997: 		  ok;
 1998: 	      {RedDiff, Reductions} ->
 1999: 		  ct:fail({unexpected_reduction_count, Reductions})
 2000: 	  end,
 2001: 
 2002:     none = next_tmsg(P),
 2003: 
 2004:     ok.
 2005: 
 2006: next_tmsg(Pid) ->
 2007:     receive
 2008: 	TMsg when is_tuple(TMsg),
 2009: 		  element(1, TMsg) == trace,
 2010: 		  element(2, TMsg) == Pid ->
 2011: 	    TMsg
 2012:     after 100 ->
 2013: 	    none
 2014:     end.
 2015: 
 2016: dist_unlink_ack_exit_leak(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2017:     %% Verification of nc reference counts when stopping node
 2018:     %% will find the bug if it exists...
 2019:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(),
 2020:     ParentFun =
 2021:         fun () ->
 2022:                 %% Give parent some work to do when
 2023:                 %% exiting to increase the likelyhood
 2024:                 %% of the bug triggereing...
 2025:                 T = ets:new(x,[]),
 2026:                 ets:insert(T, lists:map(fun (I) ->
 2027:                                                 {I,I}
 2028:                                         end,
 2029:                                         lists:seq(1,10000))),
 2030:                 Chld = spawn_link(Node,
 2031:                                   fun () ->
 2032:                                           receive
 2033:                                           after infinity ->
 2034:                                                   ok
 2035:                                           end
 2036:                                   end),
 2037:                 erlang:yield(),
 2038:                 unlink(Chld),
 2039:                 exit(bye)
 2040:         end,
 2041:     PMs = lists:map(fun (_) ->
 2042:                             spawn_monitor(ParentFun)
 2043:                     end, lists:seq(1, 10)),
 2044:     lists:foreach(fun ({P, M}) ->
 2045:                           receive
 2046:                               {'DOWN', M, process, P, bye} ->
 2047:                                   ok
 2048:                           end
 2049:                   end, PMs),
 2050:     stop_node(Peer, Node),
 2051:     ok.
 2052: 
 2053: %% Test that bad arguments to register/2 cause an exception.
 2054: bad_register(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2055:     Name = a_long_and_unused_name,
 2056: 
 2057:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch register({bad,name}, self())),
 2058:     fail_register(undefined, self()),
 2059:     fail_register([bad,name], self()),
 2060: 
 2061:     {Dead,Mref} = spawn_monitor(fun() -> true end),
 2062:     receive
 2063: 	{'DOWN',Mref,process,Dead,_} -> ok
 2064:     end,
 2065:     fail_register(Name, Dead),
 2066:     fail_register(Name, make_ref()),
 2067:     fail_register(Name, []),
 2068:     fail_register(Name, {bad,process}),
 2069:     fail_register(Name, <<>>),
 2070:     ok.
 2071: 
 2072: fail_register(Name, Process) ->
 2073:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch register(Name, Process)),
 2074:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch Name ! anything_goes),
 2075:     ok.
 2076: 
 2077: garbage_collect(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2078:     Prio = process_flag(priority, high),
 2079:     true = erlang:garbage_collect(),
 2080:     
 2081:     TokLoopers = lists:map(fun (_) ->
 2082: 		spawn_opt(fun tok_loop/0, [{priority, low}, link])
 2083: 	end, lists:seq(1, 10)),
 2084: 
 2085:     lists:foreach(fun (Pid) ->
 2086: 		Mon = erlang:monitor(process, Pid),
 2087: 		DownBefore = receive
 2088: 		    {'DOWN', Mon, _, _, _} ->
 2089: 			true
 2090: 		after 0 ->
 2091: 			false
 2092: 		end,
 2093: 		GC = erlang:garbage_collect(Pid),
 2094: 		DownAfter = receive
 2095: 		    {'DOWN', Mon, _, _, _} ->
 2096: 			true
 2097: 		after 0 ->
 2098: 			false
 2099: 		end,
 2100: 		true = erlang:demonitor(Mon),
 2101: 		case {DownBefore, DownAfter} of
 2102: 		    {true, _} -> false = GC;
 2103: 		    {false, false} -> true = GC;
 2104: 		    _ -> GC
 2105: 		end
 2106: 	end, processes()),
 2107: 
 2108:     lists:foreach(fun (Pid) ->
 2109: 		unlink(Pid),
 2110: 		exit(Pid, bang)
 2111: 	end, TokLoopers),
 2112:     process_flag(priority, Prio),
 2113:     ok.
 2114: 
 2115: %% This used to cause the nofrag emulator to dump core
 2116: process_info_messages(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2117:     process_info_messages_test(),
 2118:     ok.
 2119: 
 2120: process_info_messages_loop(0) -> ok;
 2121: process_info_messages_loop(N) -> process_info_messages_loop(N-1).
 2122: 
 2123: process_info_messages_send_my_msgs_to(Rcvr) ->
 2124:     receive
 2125: 	Msg ->
 2126: 	    Rcvr ! Msg,
 2127: 	    process_info_messages_send_my_msgs_to(Rcvr)
 2128:     after 0 ->
 2129: 	    ok
 2130:     end.
 2131: 
 2132: process_info_messages_test() ->
 2133:     Go = make_ref(),
 2134:     Done = make_ref(),
 2135:     Rcvr = self(),
 2136:     Rcvr2 = spawn_link(fun () ->
 2137: 		receive {Go, Rcvr} -> ok end,
 2138: 		garbage_collect(),
 2139: 		Rcvr ! {Done, self()}
 2140: 	end),
 2141:     Sndrs = lists:map(
 2142: 	fun (_) ->
 2143: 		spawn_link(fun () ->
 2144: 			    Rcvr ! {Go, self()},
 2145: 			    receive {Go, Rcvr} -> ok end,
 2146: 			    BigData = lists:seq(1, 1000),
 2147: 			    Rcvr ! BigData,
 2148: 			    Rcvr ! BigData,
 2149: 			    Rcvr ! BigData,
 2150: 			    Rcvr ! {Done, self()}
 2151: 		    end)
 2152: 	end, lists:seq(1, 10)),
 2153:     lists:foreach(fun (Sndr) -> receive {Go, Sndr} -> ok end end,
 2154: 			Sndrs),
 2155:     garbage_collect(),
 2156:     erlang:yield(),
 2157:     lists:foreach(fun (Sndr) -> Sndr ! {Go, self()} end, Sndrs),
 2158:     process_info_messages_loop(100000000),
 2159:     Msgs = process_info(self(), messages),
 2160:     lists:foreach(fun (Sndr) -> receive {Done, Sndr} -> ok end end,
 2161: 			Sndrs),
 2162:     garbage_collect(),
 2163:     Rcvr2 ! Msgs,
 2164:     process_info_messages_send_my_msgs_to(Rcvr2),
 2165:     Rcvr2 ! {Go, self()},
 2166:     garbage_collect(),
 2167:     receive {Done, Rcvr2} -> ok end,
 2168:     Msgs.
 2169: 
 2170: chk_badarg(Fun) ->
 2171:     try Fun(), exit(no_badarg) catch error:badarg -> ok end.
 2172: 
 2173: process_flag_badarg(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2174:     chk_badarg(fun () -> process_flag(gurka, banan) end),
 2175:     chk_badarg(fun () -> process_flag(trap_exit, gurka) end),
 2176:     chk_badarg(fun () -> process_flag(error_handler, 1) end),
 2177:     chk_badarg(fun () -> process_flag(fullsweep_after, gurka) end),
 2178:     chk_badarg(fun () -> process_flag(min_heap_size, gurka) end),
 2179:     chk_badarg(fun () -> process_flag(min_bin_vheap_size, gurka) end),
 2180:     chk_badarg(fun () -> process_flag(min_bin_vheap_size, -1) end),
 2181: 
 2182:     chk_badarg(fun () -> process_flag(max_heap_size, gurka) end),
 2183:     chk_badarg(fun () -> process_flag(max_heap_size, -1) end),
 2184:     chk_badarg(fun () ->
 2185:                        {_,Min} = process_info(self(), min_heap_size),
 2186:                        process_flag(max_heap_size, Min - 1)
 2187:                end),
 2188:     chk_badarg(fun () ->
 2189:                        {_,Min} = process_info(self(), min_heap_size),
 2190:                        process_flag(max_heap_size, #{size => Min - 1})
 2191:                end),
 2192:     chk_badarg(fun () -> process_flag(max_heap_size, #{}) end),
 2193:     chk_badarg(fun () -> process_flag(max_heap_size, #{ kill => true }) end),
 2194:     chk_badarg(fun () -> process_flag(max_heap_size, #{ size => 233,
 2195:                                                         kill => gurka }) end),
 2196:     chk_badarg(fun () -> process_flag(max_heap_size, #{ size => 233,
 2197:                                                         error_logger => gurka }) end),
 2198:     chk_badarg(fun () -> process_flag(max_heap_size, #{ size => 233,
 2199:                                                         include_shared_binaries => gurka}) end),
 2200:     chk_badarg(fun () -> process_flag(max_heap_size, #{ size => 233,
 2201:                                                         kill => true,
 2202:                                                         error_logger => gurka }) end),
